articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Officials and Employees of Fruit Farm
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Officials and Employees of Fruit Farm 
						
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was so kind as to send his autograph "July 14, 2011 Kim Jong Il" to officials and employees of the Kosan Fruit Farm in reply to their letter to him.
					 On June 12 they sent a letter to him carrying their pledge to repay his loving care and trust shown for them. Kim Jong Il visited the fruit farm several times, clearly indicating the way for it to follow and turning it into a nation's leading modern fruit producer. 
					
					 In their letter they expressed their determination to steadily push forward the project for expanding its capacity and intensify the drive to put the fruit production on a higher scientific, modern and intensive basis in the transparent spirit of devotedly protecting the leader, spirit of national self-esteem, the spirit of self-reliance and in the spirit of love and devotion for the future.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Colombian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Colombian President
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Juan Manuel Santos, president of Colombia, on its 201st independence day. 
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably, the message wished the president greater success in his work for stability and development of the country and promotion of people's wellbeing.

articles.title: Talks Held between DPRK FM and His Mongolian Counterpart
articles.content:
Talks Held between DPRK FM and His Mongolian Counterpart
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on a visit to Mongolia held talks with Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of External Relations of Mongolia, at the building of the ministry on Monday. 
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of the DPRK delegation, the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia and from the Mongolian side officials of the ministry and the Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK. 
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation in their countries and exchanged views on boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and issues of common concern.

articles.title: Indian Embassy Officials Visit Art Studio and University
articles.content:
Indian Embassy Officials Visit Art Studio and University
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Pratap Singh and staff members of the Indian embassy here visited the Mansudae Art Studio Tuesday on the 35th anniversary of the signing of cultural agreement between the governments of the DPRK and India.
					 They toured various production rooms, being briefed on the fact that the studio has turned into a comprehensive Juche-oriented fine art production center.
					
					 The ambassador said that they would strive to further develop exchange and cooperation in science, education, culture and other fields in keeping with the requirement of the agreement.
					
					 They also visited Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association led by Chairman Mamoru Kitahara arrived here Tuesday.

articles.title: Senior Officials Enjoy July Concert of Unhasu Orchestra
articles.content:
Senior Officials Enjoy "July Concert" of Unhasu Orchestra 
  Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials and officials of the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions enjoyed the "July concert" given by the Unhasu Orchestra at the newly rebuilt Unhasu Theatre on Tuesday.
					 Its repertoire included prelude "Fortune of Korea", orchestra and chorus "My Country Is So Nice," Okryugum and female trio "Royal Azaleas in Taehongdan", narration and choruses "World of Yearning" and "Glory to Our Great Party".
					
					 The concert was acclaimed by the audience as it kept alive the nature of Korean music and showed the progress made by the Juche-based arts which developed on a new level through truthful artistic representation.

articles.title: Order of Kim Il Sung Awarded to Senior Party Official
articles.content:
Order of Kim Il Sung Awarded to Senior Party Official
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Il Sung was conferred on Kwon Hyok Bong, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 He made a signal contribution to educating the Party members, servicepersons and working people in a revolutionary way and encouraging them to the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche by helping produce in the field of culture and arts the monumental masterpieces of the era flawless in ideological contents and artistry suited to the features of a prosperous and powerful country.
					
					  A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on awarding the order was issued on Tuesday.

articles.title: Citations Conferred on Meritorious Persons in DPRK
articles.content:
Citations Conferred on Meritorious Persons in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- A ceremony was held in Pyongyang to award commendations to officials, creators, artistes and students who performed feats in producing drama "We Will Recollect Today" on Tuesday.
					 At the ceremony, decrees of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly were read out and Kim Il Sung Prize was awarded to the drama, one of the monumental masterpieces representing the literature and arts in the era of Songun.
					
					The commendations included the title of DPRK Labor Hero and Gold Medal (Hammer and Sickle) and Order of National Flag First Class, Kim Il Sung Prize, watch bearing the august name of President Kim Il Sung (to four persons), citation of General Secretary Kim Jong Il (to six), Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize, Kim Il Sung Children Honor Prize, honorary titles, Order of National Flag First Class, Order of Labor, and Orders of National Flag Second and Third Class and Medal of Merit.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the SPA, An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, officials concerned and those involved in the production of the drama.

articles.title: World Population Day Marked
articles.content:
World Population Day Marked
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- A seminar on "World Population Day-The World at 7 Billion" took place in Hamhung, South Hamgyong Province of the DPRK on Monday. 
					 Present at the seminar were a staff member of the UN Population Fund mission in the DPRK, officials concerned and researchers. 
					
					 The seminar heard speeches under the titles "Population Situation and Prospect," "On Aging Population Situation" and others.
					
					 Speakers referred to the fact that in the DPRK healthcare for women and children are being improved and state investment in this field is on the increase. 
					
					 They stressed that the DPRK would boost cooperation with international bodies including the UN Population Fund to implement the action program of the international population development conference and achieve the Millennium Development Goals in the future, too. 
					
					 Seminars held in Pyongyang and Hamhung to mark World Population Day provided an opportunity to increase the social awareness of the UN Population Fund's mission and cooperation and healthcare and guarantee of the rights of the women and children in the DPRK, etc.

articles.title: Commodity Exhibition Hall Crowded with People
articles.content:
Commodity Exhibition Hall Crowded with People
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The second commodity exhibition is going on successfully at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1 in the DPRK.
					 On display at the exhibition hall are quality clothes, shoes, foodstuffs, house furnishings and other consumer goods.
					
					 Many people, including officials and workers of the commercial sector, have visited the exhibition hall.
					
					 They learn about exhibits to compare them with their products. They meet with exhibitors to exchange experience in the consumer good output and find out ways for bettering the quality of their products.
					
					 They also discuss improving the supply system of consumer goods as required by the present times.
					
					 The exhibition provides the visitors with a good knowledge of the solid foundations of the DPRK's light industry.
					
					 Kong Chang Sik, an official of the Ministry of Commerce, told KCNA the exhibition serves as a good example showing that the output of quality consumer goods can be increased when their producers make the maximum use of the production potentials.

articles.title: Housewives' Workteam Management Office Famous for Quality Consumer Goods
articles.content:
Housewives' Workteam Management Office Famous for Quality Consumer Goods
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Mangyongdae District Direct Sales Shop in Pyongyang draws many people.
					 Catching their eyes in the shop are consumer goods like bags of various shapes and colors made by the Housewives' Workteam Management Office.
					
					 Director of the management office Kim Yong Son told KCNA that the office often organizes emulation among workteams and employees to increase the variety of goods and improve their quality.
					
					 It also sponsors exhibitions to encourage them to make popular goods, she said. Officials of the management office frequent the shop to learn about consumers' opinion and find out ways for improving the quality of products.
					
					 In the country the August 3 Consumer Goods Production Movement is one of the all-people movements, through which quality consumer goods have been produced in large quantities to contribute to bettering the people's standard of living.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Authorities Blasted for Suppressing Progressive Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Authorities Blasted for Suppressing Progressive Forces 
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative authorities have recently become desperate in their campaign to suppress the progressive forces. This is, however, nothing but sinister acts to weather the worsening ruling crisis and get rid of the abyss of ruin as it is a trite method they employed whenever they found themselves in a tight corner. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined commentary. 
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is now paying a high price for the hideous crimes committed against the country and the nation, obsessed with sycophancy towards the U.S., fascist dictatorship and confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					
					 Angry shouts of such slogans as "Down with Lee Myung Bak regime!" are heard from anti-"government" meetings taking place almost everyday in south Korea, which has turned into a scene condemning his traitorous policy. The conservative group had already begun going on the decline due to its defeat in the "election to the local self-governing bodies" last year and the recent by-election. It has been thrown into such difficult position that it is hard to save its destiny. This group is now seized with such fear that it may fail in the "National Assembly" and "presidential" elections due next year and can hardly realize its dream of staying in power. It is, therefore, seeking a way out of this in cracking down upon people. 
					
					 The fascists use "pro-communist acts" and "acts of benefiting the enemy" as pretexts for suppressing the people. What the group of traitors seeks is to crack down upon all the forces opposed to their treacherous rule by labeling them "pro-north leftists" and put down the anti-"government" struggle by resorting to violence. 
					
					 The frantic suppression proves that the conservative group is the heinous group of traitors who do not hesitate to turn south Korea into a scene of bloodshed for its staying in power, utterly indifferent to national unity and the reunification of the country. 
					
					 The south Korean conservative group is seriously mistaken if it thinks it can tide over the crisis through dictatorship and crackdown. It will only lay bare the fascist nature and ugly sight of the Lee group.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Moves for Military Overseas Expansion Flayed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Moves for Military Overseas Expansion Flayed
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government at recent round-table talks published a report the keynote of which is to examine the issue of SDF's participation in the performance of the main duty of "UN peace-keeping forces" including armistice supervision.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard: This is no more than the Japanese reactionaries' scenario to legally hurl SDF into overseas military expansion under the disguise of the "UN peace-keeping forces." 
					
					 It is ridiculous for Japan to claim it would make "a contribution" to global peace and security while presenting itself as "a pacifist state."
					
					 The international community has never asked Japan to dispatch its SDF as part of "UN peace-keeping forces". The world public is displeased and cautious about Japan's attempt to have a role in them as it is seized with the militarist ambition.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have stepped up the preparations for SDF's overseas operations by craftily taking advantage of the changed international situation. They are now set to realize their ambition at any cost.
					
					 Japan is so emboldened by its moves to regain its appearance in the "imperial era" under the pretext of "contributing to global peace" that it is set to openly dispatch SDF into different countries and regions of the world in a bid to demonstrate its military muscle.
					
					 It is beyond doubt that in case Japan's militarist forces are allowed to participate in the military operations of the "UN peace-keeping forces" in a bid to repeat their crime-woven past, global peace and security will be threatened and the international community disturbed.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to behave themselves, mindful that the international community is watching with great worry and caution their undisguised moves to turn Japan into a military power and launch overseas expansion.

articles.title: Japan's Ambition to Stage Comeback to Korea Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Ambition to Stage Comeback to Korea Blasted
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Japan is set to lay a groundwork for the advance of the Japan "Self-Defence Forces" into the Korean Peninsula without any trouble in "contingency" on the peninsula by realizing "tripartite security dialogue" involving the United States, Japan and south Korea, according to a diplomatic cable of the U.S. embassy in Tokyo disclosed by WikiLeaks. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This provides a clear testimony that Japan by no means remains unconcerned about the situation on the Korean Peninsula but it is dreaming of realizing its ambition to stage comeback to Korea at any cost when the time comes. 
					
					 Japan professes the principle of "exclusive defense." So, there is no need for it to be busy sending SDF, warships and aircraft to other countries on account of anything happening there.
					
					 It is the strategy of the U.S. to form a triangular military alliance grouping the U.S., Japan and south Korea and, on this basis, to pursue military hegemony and domination over East Asia. 
					
					 It is the ridiculous calculation of Japan that its zealous pursuance of the U.S. strategy to dominate the region would help gain a chance of military intervention in the Korean Peninsula, the world's biggest hotspot, and, furthermore, secure a pretext for igniting a war of overseas aggression. 
					
					 Japan is rushing headlong into a war, not peace, after totally reneging on its commitment made before the international community. 
					
					 If the Japanese reactionaries dare launch reinvasion, the army and people of the DPRK will deal the most telling blows at them till they are completely wiped out, warns commentary.

articles.title: Uninterrupted Advance for Prosperity of Kim Il Sung's Korea Called for
articles.content:
Uninterrupted Advance for Prosperity of Kim Il Sung's Korea Called for 
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday editorially calls on all the party members, servicepersons and people to steadily put spurs to a leap forward and all-out offensive under the leadership of the great Workers' Party of Korea and dynamically step up the advance for a great surge for realizing the behests of President Kim Il Sung for building a rich and powerful nation.
					 The editorial says:
					
					 All the servicepersons and people are advancing like the wind, putting steady spurs to the general advance toward 2012 by displaying indomitable faith and spirit that Korea does whatever it is determined to do. 
					
					 The idea of the President and his august name serve as an eternal signpost for the army and people of the DPRK to win. No force on earth can block their heroic advance to glorify the one hundred-year-history of Kim Il Sung's Korea and usher in a new era of prosperity along the road of Juche indicated by the President. 
					
					 All the party members, servicepersons and people are now firmly determined to continue dynamically stepping up the advance, single-mindedly united around leader Kim Jong Il and thus successfully accomplish the cause of the President for building a thriving country. 
					
					 The might of single-minded unity that has grown stronger than ever before with the historic WPK Conference as an occasion represents the most important part of the national power of the DPRK. 
					
					The song "The Victorious Road" sung out with the start of the general offensive this year is resounding forth more loudly to encourage the servicepersons and people in their uninterrupted innovations and advance. It is the firm faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK to carry out without fail the Korean revolution started by the President, winning victories under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, and thus achieve the prosperity of the country, concludes the editorial.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (16)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (16)
						
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Songgan Secondary School in Songgan County, Jagang Province is well known for raising more than 10,000 rabbits every year through a do-good-thing campaign.
					 Such success would be unthinkable without the unrewarded efforts of Ro Jong Sun, a biology teacher of the school.
					
					While providing field guidance to the province in August 2000, General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the school and met with her.
					
					 After being briefed on the rabbit raising, he went round the "rabbit hill" of the school. He called upon the schools across the country and relevant units to learn from the experience gained by the school in raising rabbits.
					
					 The school in the mountainous area was well known to the country as a school good at raising rabbit under the care of the leader.
					
					 Ro Jong Sun has worked heart and soul to generalize her success across the country. She exerted greater efforts for this work and told participants in the 250 mile study tours the experience in rabbit raising.
					
					 The fields of education and agriculture across the country and units of the Korean People's Army are benefiting from the experience gained by the school in rabbit raising. Rabbits raised by Dr. of Zootechnics Ro are highly estimated at each national rabbit show.

articles.title: US Forces' Stockpile of Depleted Uranium Shells in S. Korea Disclosed
articles.content:
US Forces' Stockpile of Depleted Uranium Shells in S. Korea Disclosed
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- It has been recently disclosed that the U.S. forces in south Korea stockpiled depleted uranium shells in their base in Chunchon before it was transferred, sparking public uproar.
					 A medium of south Korea recently obtained and opened to public the full text of a report about the results of the survey of radiation in the U.S. military base in Chunchon which had been transferred to south Korea in 2005.
					
					 According to the report, at that time an environment business conducted a separate survey of radiation in the Chunchon base, clarifying the radiation level was higher than the average one in places outside parts store and lodging quarters.
					
					 The claim that the U.S. forces in south Korea stored depleted uranium shells in the Chunchon base was made by Ri Si U, the then cameraman-writer. 
					
					 Ri cited data, sent by an American organization urging the Command of the U.S Forces in the Pacific to open information to the public, to disclose the fact that 3 million depleted uranium shells were stockpiled in the U.S. air-force bases in Suwon, Osan and other places. It is highly likely that such shells might be stored in the U.S. military base in Chunchon where a helicopter unit was stationed, he asserted.
					
					 It has been recently revealed that a nuclear warhead which caused an accident in 1972 was scrapped at this base.
					
					 The U.S. forces in south Korea officially admitted their possession of depleted uranium shells in 1997 and, afterwards, one shell was found mixed with the scrapped shells in Ryonchon County, Kyonggi Province, stirring up outcry.

articles.title: S. Korean Police and Military Authorities Hit for Suppression of Protestors
articles.content:
S. Korean Police and Military Authorities Hit for Suppression of Protestors
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Measure Council for Checking the Construction of Jeju Naval Base held an emergency press conference outside the "government general building" on July 15 to denounce the police crackdown upon the participants in the actions against the construction of the base for aggression.
					 Speakers at the conference recalled that at dawn that day the police suddenly walked off the chief of Kangjong Village on Jeju Island and two others, including the chairman of the Inhabitants Measure Committee Opposing the Construction of Jeju Naval Base, protesting the arrest.
					
					 This means a start of the wholesale repression offensive against the actions of people from all walks of life against the construction of the naval base, they said. They warned they would turn out in a dynamic protest campaign, if the authorities put in custody those arrested.
					
					 The Jeju Island Committee of the Democratic Labor Party and other opposition parties in commentaries and statements denounced the police for its suppression and demanded it set free those arrested immediately.
					
					 The Pan-Islanders Measure Committee for Checking Jeju Military Base in a statement on July 14 condemned the military authorities for their suppression.
					
					 The Navy side recently let the construction enterprises and lawyers close to it charge Jeju island protestors against the construction of the base with disturbing it in the performance of its duty and even sued them for damage, the statement said, demanding its withdrawal.

articles.title: S. Korean Security Authorities Accused of Suppressing Reunification Movement
articles.content:
S. Korean Security Authorities Accused of Suppressing Reunification Movement
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- An Yong Min, chief editor of the south Korean magazine Minjok 21, on July 15 posted on an internet newspaper an article accusing the security authorities of cracking down on the reunification movement.
					 On July 6 the fascist security forces searched the house of his father who was a professor at Kyongbuk National University and his house with detectors, he said in the article.
					
					 The authorities took such action on charges that his father and he got in touch with those concerned of Chongryon (the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan) and acted at their instructions and drew people into the organization, he noted.
					
					 Recalling that they legally visited the north and met with those concerned of Chongryon as part of their contacts during the preceding regime, he queried if this can be a crime. If things are dealt with like this, all the organizations and officials who participated in the inter-Korean exchange after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration should be criminals, he deplored. 
					
					 It is an anachronistic conception that anyone coming in touch with the north and exchanging views with it is tantamount to a breach of the clause banning meeting, communicating with the north and getting instructions from it and the progressive movement of the south side hinges on the political operation of the north. Anyone cannot but fall victim to the "National Security Law" as long as this conception of the security organ remains unchanged. This is the present reality of south Korea, he added.

articles.title: Cabinet Reshuffle in S. Korea Ridiculed
articles.content:
Cabinet Reshuffle in S. Korea Ridiculed
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Lee Myung Bak's recent reshuffle of the minister of Justice and the chief prosecutor is being strongly rebuffed by different circles, south Korean CBS reported on July 16.
					 On July 15 Lee informally designated his confidants Kwon Jae Jin and Han Sang Dae as successors to the minister of Justice and the chief prosecutor, it said.
					
					 The Democratic Party and other opposition parties and people from all walks of life labeled the designation of the successors as the worst reshuffle and are set to check the appointment without fail at the confirmation hearing, it noted.

articles.title: Media of Various Countries Observe Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Media of Various Countries Observe Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Media of various countries gave special write-ups to the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					The Russian newspaper Nakhodkinski Rabochi on July 5 carried an article under the title of "Popular Leader" with a photo of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, was a popular leader, the article said, adding:
					
					 To believe in people as in Heaven was the maxim of the President.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea in the early period of his revolutionary activities and laid down the Juche-oriented line of the Korean revolution.
					
					 All miraculous achievements made in the DPRK were possible because the President mobilized the inexhaustible strength of the people to the maximum, strictly guided by the idea of believing in people as in Heaven.
					
					 Another Russian newspaper Selskaya Zhizn on the same day carried an article introducing the revolutionary life of the President who devoted his all to the people's happiness.
					
					 The July 4th issue of the Syrian paper Al Usubuu Al Riadih and the July issue of the Palestinian magazine Ilal Amam carried articles with portraits of the smiling President.
					
					 The articles noted that he set forth the idea of global independence and wisely led the struggle of progressive mankind against the imperialist and hegemonic forces through his energetic activities.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Foreign Organization
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Foreign Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea expressed support and solidarity with the DPRK's measures for self-defence.
					 This support was manifested in its statement released on July 14 to mark the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					
					 July 27 was the day of victory won by the Korean people in safeguarding the freedom and independence of the country, the statement said, adding:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung led the Fatherland Liberation War to victory with his brilliant strategy and tactics. 
					
					 The shining victory won by the Korean people in the sacred anti-U.S. war became a shining example in accomplishing the cause of global independence.
					
					 The statement called on the world progressives to turn out in the struggle to protect peace in the Korean peninsula and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Month of Anti-US Joint Struggle Observed in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Month of Anti-US Joint Struggle Observed in Bangladesh
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee on July 13 issued a bulletin under the title of "Distinguished Military Strategist" to mark the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The article said:
					
					 The Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War to beat back the U.S. imperialists' armed invasion in the 1950s would have been unthinkable without the distinguished military strategy of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Soon after the war broke out he issued an order to beat back the attack of the aggressors and go over to a prompt counter-attack, thereby making sure that the Korean People's Army liberated Seoul, the bulwark of the enemy in just three days. 
					
					 He indicated original war methods including tunnel warfare and the aircraft hunting team movement, leading the KPA to win a victory in every battle and win a final victory in the war.  
					
					 The UN forces commander, Clark, when signing the armistice agreement which was little short of a surrender document signifying the U.S. defeat in the Korean war, admitted that the north Korean army won victory thanks to General Kim Il Sung's able command.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Various events were held in many countries from July 6 to 13 to commemorate the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included a seminar on Kim Il Sung's exploits in Pakistan and film shows in Malaysia, Russia and Indonesia and by the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement.
					
					 The secretary general of the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association and other speakers said the President defeated the Japanese and the U.S. imperialisms, built a socialist power in Korea and helped the people of many countries in the anti-imperialist struggle both materially and morally out of the noble sense of internationalist obligation.
					
					 The great feats performed by the President for the Korean revolution and the world revolution will shine generation after generation, they stressed.
					
					 They expressed support and solidarity for the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation and realize the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Malaysian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung called for organizing various events praising his undying feats.
					
					 The executive advisor to the general secretary of the Pan-African Movement said progressive humankind is praising the President as an outstanding leader.
					
					A message to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted at an event held in Pakistan.

articles.title: Okinawa Pref. Assembly Seeks Cancellation of Osprey Deployment
articles.content:
Okinawa Pref. Assembly Seeks Cancellation of Osprey Deployment
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Okinawa prefectural assembly adopted a resolution Thursday to demand Tokyo and Washington cancel the planned deployment of MV-22 Osprey vertical takeoff and landing aircraft at the U.S. Marine Corps' Futenma Air Station.
					 The assembly referred to risks surrounding the aircraft's operation, saying it resulted in ''many casualties in repeated crashes at its development stage'' and that its deployment goes ''against the effort to eliminate dangers'' of the Futenma base.
					
					 It also strongly criticized the Japanese government's claim that the plan is merely a change of aircraft model to be deployed at the Futenma base, saying Tokyo ''ignores human rights and the life of the Okinawa people.''

articles.title: US Protests Japan's Handling of Radioactive Beef
articles.content:
US Protests Japan's Handling of Radioactive Beef
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. government lodged a protest with Japan on July 12 over its handling the issue of radioactive cesium-contaminated beef from Fukushima Prefecture.
					 At a bilateral meeting on the crisis at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant in Tokyo Charles Casto, head of the U.S. side, reportedly said no explanation had been provided from the Japanese government prior to a press release.  
					
					 Casto expressed dissatisfaction with Tokyo's response to the issue, noting that the contaminated beef had been discovered despite Tokyo notifying that food not subject to shipment suspensions was safe, said a news report.

articles.title: China Seeks Higher Global Innovation Ranking
articles.content:
China Seeks Higher Global Innovation Ranking 
 Beijing, July 18 (KCNA) -- China will raise its global innovation ranking over the next five years, according to a newly issued national scientific and technological blueprint of the 12th five-year plan.
					 The blueprint, issued by the Ministry of Science and Technology on July 13, contains the country's scientific and technological development goals for the coming five years. It specifies that China's global innovation ranking will be raised from 21st to 18th in the world. 
					
					 It also envisages that China will hold 55 percent of progress made in science and technology.

articles.title: Military Game Software Developed in China
articles.content:
Military Game Software Developed in China
 Beijing, July 18 (KCNA) -- Scientists and researchers belonging to the 2nd Artillery of the Chinese People's Liberation Army have developed a military game software in cooperation with a local network science and technology company. 
					 The software includes ten games, including military training standard and all-round soldier. 
					
					 An official in charge of the development said the software would be supplemented to help servicepersons gain in wisdom.

articles.title: Russia Sends Satellite into Orbit
articles.content:
Russia Sends Satellite into Orbit
 Moscow, July 18 (KCNA) -- Russia successfully launched a carrier rocket Proton-M on July 16.
					 The rocket, launched from the Baikonur Space Center in Kazakhstan, carried a Kazakh satellite KazSat-2 into orbit.
					
					 The mission of the satellite with a 12-year serviceable life is to provide television and broadcast services for Kazakhstan and other Central Asian countries, as well as central Russia.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Calls for Pushing forward Socialist Construction
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Calls for Pushing forward Socialist Construction
						
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias, speaking at a Cabinet meeting on July 14, called for speeding up socialist construction.
					 It is only possible to go over to Bolivar socialism from capitalism, he said.
					
					 He underlined the need to intensify the building of Venezuelan-style socialism based on the theory of scientific planning now being applied in practice.

articles.title: Nigerian President Vows to Fight Corruption
articles.content:
Nigerian President Vows to Fight Corruption
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Nigerian President Goodluck Jonathan clarified the stand to fight corruption in a speech at a ceremony on Thursday.
					 "Corruption is the monster that we need to confront and defeat. The war against corruption will start at the center," he told his cabinet.
					
					 He asked members of the cabinet not to see their position as a reward for status, but as an opportunity to serve the people of Nigeria.

articles.title: Myanmar to Build First Ever Liver Transplant Hospital
articles.content:
Myanmar to Build First Ever Liver Transplant Hospital
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Myanmar is projecting to build the first-ever liver transplant hospital.
					 Myanmar experts carried out successful liver-transplant operation in 2004 for the first time and in 2009 for the second time.
					
					 The hospital will offer services for the patients living with heart and kidney diseases.
					
					 The government allotted many funds for the building of the hospital.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- China is willing to make concerted efforts with the United Arab Emirates to consolidate cooperation and push forward bilateral ties to a higher level, a senior Chinese official said Wednesday.
					 Business representatives from both Cuba and Russia signed an action plan on Wednesday to strengthen bilateral economic and trade cooperation.

articles.title: Economic Depression in Japan, Spain
articles.content:
Economic Depression in Japan, Spain
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Fast Retailing Co. of Japan Thursday quoted survey data as saying its group net profit in the first nine months from September last year fell 20.5 percent from a year earlier to 53.40 billion yen.
					 Spain recorded a 30.4 percent fall in house sales in the first quarter in 2011, compared with the same quarter in 2010, the country's National Institute of Statistics said on July 11.
					
					 Such sales fall is related to the decline of buying power of the inhabitants due to economic depression.

articles.title: Debt Crisis Threatens Euro-area Nations
articles.content:
Debt Crisis Threatens Euro-area Nations
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The serious debt crisis has deteriorated the economic situation of euro-area nations.
					 "Some euro-area sovereigns continue to face acute challenges in debt storm. Greece in particular remains in the eye of the storm," the European Commission said on July 13 in a quarterly report of the euro area.
					
					 The economic growth of the euro area is expected to slow down in the coming quarters and will remain uneven across member states, said the report.

articles.title: Volcano Erupts in Indonesia, Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Volcano Erupts in Indonesia, Earthquake Hits Japan
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Volcano erupted in North Sulawesi Province, Indonesia Thursday.
					 The volcanic ash went up to 1,500 meters high.
					
					 The area around the volcano was declared dangerous zone and thousands of inhabitants were evacuated.
					
					 A 5.5-magnitude earthquake hit Kanto area of Japan on July 15.
					
					 The epicenter was about 60 km underground in the southern area of Ibaraki Prefecture.

articles.title: Natural Damage in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Damage in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- At least ten people were killed and six others missing due to landslides triggered by monsoon rains in Nepal's western and central remote mountainous districts on Friday.
					 The hurricane swept the southern part of Dominica recently. Due to the hurricane accompanied by heavy rains, three persons were killed and at least 600 homes damaged and about 2 408 people displaced as of July 13.
					
					 Flashfloods due to heavy rains are expanding in the southern Philippines. The death toll reached 43, government officials said Wednesday. Around 450,000 children are reportedly at risk of diarrhea diseases and pneumonia.
					
					 The rescuing work is being done at the flood-stricken areas.

articles.title: Shipping Piracy Surges Worldwide
articles.content:
Shipping Piracy Surges Worldwide
 Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Piracy is surging worldwide to stir up great concern of the international community.
					 Piracy on the high seas surged in the first six months of this year to 266 cases worldwide, compared to 196 a year ago, the International Maritime Bureau said in a report released Thursday.

articles.title: 7,500 Nuclear Weapons Deployed in World
articles.content:
7,500 Nuclear Weapons Deployed in World
						
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The number of nuclear weapons deployed in the world by eight nuclear nations totals 7,500 as of the beginning of last year. 
					 The Stockholm International Peace Research Institute released the figure in its yearbook.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il firma la carta de empleados de granja de Kosan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il firma la carta de empleados de granja de Kosan
						
Pyongyang, 19 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il leyó la carta que le enviaron los funcionarios y empleados de la Granja Frutícola de Kosan y escribió al pie de ella esta frase: "14 de julio de 2011, Kim Jong Il".
					En su misiva expedida el 12 de junio, los remitentes juraron responder con el incremento de producción de frutas al amor y a la confianza del Dirigente quien visitó varias veces esa granja frutícola para indicar el rumbo a seguir por ella y la convirtió en una renombrada y moderna base de producción de frutas.
					
					Hicieron énfasis en que seguirán impulsando la obra de ampliación de la capacidad de la granja con la disposición de defender al líder a costa de la vida, la fuerte dignidad nacional, la autoconfianza, el amor y la abnegación por el futuro. 
					
					Igualmente, aseguraron que asentarían la producción de frutas sobre la base científica, moderna e intensiva.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Pak Ui Chun y Gombojab Zandanshatar
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Pak Ui Chun y Gombojab Zandanshatar 
Pyongyang, 19 de julio (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el día 18 en la sede del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio de Mongolia las conversaciones entre el canciller Pak Ui Chun, jefe de la delegación de la República Popular Democrática de Corea de visita en Mongolia, y su homólogo de Mongolia, Gombojab Zandanshatar.
					Participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegación y el embajador coreano en Mongolia y por la mongol los funcionarios de la citada cartera y el embajador mongol en Corea.
					
					En la ocasión ambas partes informaron de la situación de sus respectivos países e intercambiaron criterios sobre el problema de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad entre los dos países y otros asuntos de interés mutuo.

articles.title: Cuadros presencian el "concierto de julio" de la orquesta Unhasu
articles.content:
Cuadros presencian el "concierto de julio" de la orquesta Unhasu
						
Pyongyang, 19 de julio (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este martes en el reconstruido Teatro Unhasu el "concierto de julio" de la orquesta Unhasu.
					Lo disfrutaron los cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado y los funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros, ministerios e instituciones centrales.
					
					En la escena se presentaron las piezas de diferentes géneros, tales como el preludio "Fortuna de Corea", la música orquestal y coro "¡Qué buena es mi Patria!", el trío femenino acompañado de Okryugum (instrumento musical de Corea) "El rododendro de Taehongdan", la narración y coro "El mundo de añoranza" y "Gloria a nuestro gran partido".
					
					El concierto arrancó la efusiva ovación del público por haber destacado el atributo de la música coreana con una original descripción artística y mostrado bien el aspecto de desarrollo del arte Juche que ascendió a la nueva altura.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica represión a  fuerzas progresistas en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica represión a  fuerzas progresistas en Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 19 de julio (ATCC) -- En estos días, las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas se acaloran en reprimir a las fuerzas progresistas con el fin de salvarse de la crisis de dominación cada día más agravante.
					Señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este martes y prosigue:
					
					La banda surcoreana de Lee Myung Bak, que enloquecida por el servilismo proyanqui, la dictadura fascista y la confrontación fratricida, cometió incontables crímenes ante el país y la nación, paga caro el precio merecido. 
					
					En los mítines anti-"gobierno" que se desarrollan diariamente en todos los rincones de la sociedad surcoreana se escuchan los gritos de indignación como "Abajo el poder de Lee Myung Bak" y toda la extensión surcoreana se convierte en un lugar de condena a la política traidora de Lee. 
					
					Ya se encuentra en la situación irremediable el destino de la banda conservadora que comenzó a hacerse desfavorable por las "elecciones de autonomía local" del año pasado y las recientes "elecciones" suplementarias. 
					
					Inquietados de que no podrían ganarse en las "elecciones de diputados a la asamblea nacional" y en las "elecciones presidenciales" del año próximo ni lograr la ambición de retomar el poder, los conservadores surcoreanos buscan su salida en la represión a los habitantes tildándoles de "pro-comunistas" y "pro-enemigos".
					
					La banda traidora tiene la malsana intención de crear la zona sin lucha contra el "gobierno" al reprimir brutalmente a todas las fuerzas que se oponen a su dominación y amenazarlas con las fuerzas armadas. 
					
					El hecho muestra que los compinches de la banda conservadora surcoreana es una horda de traidores que para mantener su mandato comente sin vacilación alguna hasta las represiones sangrientas, dando espaldas a la unidad nacional y la reunificación del país. 
					
					Si la banda conservadora surcoreana piensa que podría salvarse de la crisis con las políticas dictatorial y violenta, esto es una gran equivocación.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia expansión militar a ultramar de Japón
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia expansión militar a ultramar de Japón
						
Pyongyang, 19 de julio (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el gobierno japonés publicó en un llamado "intercambio de opiniones" el informe cuyo contenido es comprobar el problema de participación de  las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" en los trabajos principales de las "fuerzas de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz", incluida la vigilancia de armisticio.
					El periódico Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido hoy lo califica de una intención de los reaccionarios japoneses de lanzar legalmente a sus "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" en el camino de expansión militar a ultramar tildándoles de las "fuerzas de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz".
					
					Japón dice ridículamente que su país "contribuirá" a la paz y la seguridad internacionales autodenominándose a sí mismo de "Estado pacífico", comienza el comentarista y continúa:
					
					La sociedad internacional no demandó a Japón que envíe sus "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" a las "fuerzas de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz". La opinión pública del mundo no está de acuerdo con que Japón con sueño militarista despache sus "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" a las "fuerzas de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz" y le sigue con precaución.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses vinieron completando los preparativos de operación en ultramar de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" utilizando astutamente el cambio de la situación internacional e intentan realizar a toda costa su ambición.
					
					Este país isleño trata de demostrar también su capacidad militar en varios países y regiones del mundo. 
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben darse clara cuenta de que la sociedad internacional observa con gran preocupación y precaución sus maquinaciones encaminadas a convertir su país en una potencia militar y a expandir al ultramar y actuar con prudencia.
